page.title: 04Wildlife - Woods and Fields
page.content:
{Trees We have easy access to woods, mostly deciduous trees - the larch, alder, ash, sycamore, rowan, beech, birch, horse chestnut, silver birch, lime, hazel, hawthorn and blackthorn.There are a few conifers - the Norway spruce and the Scots pine.
{Flowers In the woods and fields around us is a large variety of wild flowers - bluebells, buttercups, wood anemones, lady's smock, primroses, marsh marigolds, dog rose, wild strawberry, scarlet pimpernel, violets, common vetch, bugle, colt's foot trefoil, flag irises, dog daisies, ragwort, chickweed, celandines, dog's mercury, and even the rare and protected wild orchids.
